website_summaries.verdict: A quick and simple way to automatically sort coins without needing an outlet or batteries.
pros: Holds up to 200 coins and allows for coin wrappers to be inserted in the coin tubes
Small, lightweight design makes it easy to store
cons: There's no counting function on this machine and the hopper can jam if you fill it completely
Some buyers recommend filling only halfway and turning the handle slowly

customer_reviews.title: More accurate without the wrappers
customer_reviews.text: I find that it is best not to use coin wrappers in the tubes. I used them at first, but I wanted to test the accuracy. I therefore dumped out each wrapper to count the coins manually. I found when using the wrappers the coins were one or two short. If you use no wrappers and let the coins fill to the point were they now overflow, you'll have the right amount of coins in each stack. You can then easily slide the wrapper over the stack of coins.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk.  Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Instead of "Royal Sovereign" as a product supplier, it should read, "POS". This thing isn't worth the plastic it is made from. Mis-sorts pennies into every coin tube - including dimes. You must dump all the coins out to make sure you haven't short-changed yourself or the bank. The bank wasn't happy when pennies showed up in the nickel tube. I wasn't happy when dimes showed up in the penny and nickel slots. Jams easily. No way to get jammed coins out of the hopper. Useless. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’ve used it for about 10 minutes and it’s perfect! I only had to put the handle in ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it for about 10 minutes and it’s perfect! I only had to put the handle in the slot, the easy-wrap wrappers (sold separately) in the plastic slots and put a handful of coins in the tray and I’m in business! I’m so glad I got this!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: If you like coins all over the floor, give this a try.
customer_reviews.text: Pennies are likely to jam without any hint to operator, causing nickels, pennies, and dimes to be mixed with quarters, pennies and dimes to be mixed with nickels, and dimes to be mixed with pennies. With the front door closed, you won't see this mis-sorting happen. Result: your coin rolls will simply not be worth what you claim.. While modest jams occur every 20-30 coins, serious ones happen every 200 coins or so. A serious jam requires that you remove your coin rolls and the loose change in the upper and lower trays, and spend 3-4 minutes shaking the thing upside down. If you like coins all over the floor, give this a try. I've sent mine back.
customer_reviews.author: David Stang

customer_reviews.title: Manual works better if top is removed
customer_reviews.text: Pros: simple, inexpensive, sorts accurately, manual, fast Cons: jams frequently and VERY hard to remove jammed coins unless you remove the outer cover (three screws) and just leave it off to use, then it works much better. Do not insert coin wrappers into tube until AFTER sorting since they don't work well. does not like foreign coins Overall: we sorted > $400 in coins and it did well.
customer_reviews.author: William F Young

customer_reviews.title: Coin sorting trays VS Royal Sovereign Coin Sorter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the MMF Industries coin sorting trays and tubes and the Royal Sovereign hand crank coin. Both are good I think the Royal Sovereign is better for over a hundred dollars. You can see both in action sorting over $800 in coins on search on for “coin sorting tray Cosmo” on Youtube Both sorters meet different needs Check before you buy
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo Weems

customer_reviews.title: Mehhhh BUST!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend. Gets clogged too easily and I thought my change was somewhat clean. Sometimes you have to counter rotate to unclog the coin feed....However if you counter rotate it too often or too much (which I thought I was careful not to) it will render the device useless due to internal mechanisms being undone(as mentioned in the warnings. With such a fatal flaw I do not think this device is ready for production and is of poor design. Unfortunately I attempted to return it one day too late. I'm buying one of the heavy duty mechanical ones next time. The worse $26 Bucks I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: ewornia

customer_reviews.title: Right up front - this is aweful
customer_reviews.text: Right up front - this product is aweful. Sorts dimes and pennies very easily, but nickles and quarters build up in the bucket. They do sort but not without a lot of turning on the handle. I have patience, but if I had to pay an employee to count change on this, it would become very expensive. The tubes the coins empty into are also not accurate. I found each one to be short of a coin to be wrapped. My grandson will be getting this to play with. If he destroys it, I won't be disappointed. Not worth the money no matter how cheaply it is priced.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Leblanc

customer_reviews.title: Having a blast!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is having a blast with this coin counter. He's had no problem with it getting stuck or locking up. Just turn the handle slowly and don't be in a rush. We found coin wrappers at Dollar Tree for $1 that work just fine with this.
customer_reviews.author: mumsieTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a couple months - tried TWO of them!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've had. The first one stopped working for seemingly no reason after a couple months and Amazon was kind enough to replace it and now the second one has done the same thing!.. Worked great for a couple months and now the coins will not drop down. Nothing is blocking it. The coins just spin. It's like some piece of plastic inside wears down and it just stops working. DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rogalinski

customer_reviews.title: This totally works. And it's strangely satisfying!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this!! It totally works and it's somehow strangely satisfying to see the coins drop into the wrappers :) Let them drop in ALL the way up to the very top of the plastic tube for the right coin count. And def best to purchase extra penny tubes since we prob all have WAY more of those than anything else. That's the one I changed out/filled up the most. Follow the directions and go slowly. It jams once in a while but you just reverse the crank and that generally clears it out. A very handy little machine! I also bought the same brand coin wrappers and had no trouble with those either.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine T.

customer_reviews.title: You're going to need a screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: This worked at first. I was careful to not go too fast. When it jams you turn it backward a little to clear it. But after filling a few coin rolls it jammed completely and I tried everything to free it. Finally, I took the screws out of the body and removed the outside cover. It actually works better without the outside piece. I won't be returning it because I only roll coins ever 3 or 4 years so, I'll just deal with it. But you can probably get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Snow

customer_reviews.title: wish i saved my money
customer_reviews.text: PROs: 1: looks nice. 2: crank easy to turn. CONS: 1: 10 percent of dimes go into pennies bin. 2: i put in small amount of coins and turn real slow. jams often, i had to tear apart and clear jams 6 times first time i used it. 3: used specified rolls sleeves. does not give accurate coins in sleeve. ended up using sorter to separate coins and then manually filling sleeves in.
customer_reviews.author: the peanut gallery

customer_reviews.title: buy it... but don't be in a rush
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. it does what it needs to do, but here are the rubs: I've had to take it apart a couple times already because it got jammed. the mechanism for "un-jamming" the coins (quarter back turn) is contingent on a flimsy piece of clear plastic inside that holds the coins against the sorting plate and I'm SURE it's the first thing that is going to break...... and finally: YOU CANNOT DO MANY COINS AT A TIME. I like to keep it to 20-25 coins each turn... it's still 1000x faster than sorting by hand, but I do wish I could go even faster... that's just me, though. this is very much worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: gschmitt

customer_reviews.title: Be gentle and it will do what it says.
customer_reviews.text: I watched the video posted by wadrad before I purchased this sorter. I didn't overload the hopper. I turned the handle clockwise and slowly. I also cleaned my coins because they had been stored in open containers and a catch all drawer so they were covered with dust and had other bits, such as paperclips, mixed in. I somehow missed a token which did jam the machine. I opened it up, dislodged it, and put it back together. I rolled roughly $300.00 worth of coins, and it's ready for the next batch I save. The fee at a kiosk is 12%, so it payed for itself.
customer_reviews.author: A Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I had been saving coins in a big jug for years and decided it was time to wrap them and take them to my bank. With this little gem of a machine, I wrapped $404.50 of coins in a less than an hour. It sorted them accurately and the levels in the tubes were accurate. It didn't jam once. The instructions were clear and concise about loading coins (not more than 200 at a time). I can see where it could fail if overloaded The crank is a little fragile. But if the user was careful, as I was, problems wouldn't occur...and didn't. I'll put it away on a closet shelf and use it again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine D.

customer_reviews.title: Speeds up counting your millions.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that no batteries are required. All done by manual hand crank, armstrong. Paper wrappers must be inserted all the way to the bottom of the plastic tube for an accurate count. I sorted and wrapped $148.00 in assorted coins in about 15 minutes. Do not overload the hopper, crank slow but steady, insert the paper tube to a stop at the bottom of the plastic tube, if jam occurs just back crank 1/4 turn, if you back crank the next coin will be deposited in the .25 cent roll. I love it. Very simple very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: raymero

customer_reviews.title: Truthful review after 2.5 years of use
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest with this product. It is, at best, a 3 star product. Pros: Price Cons: Not 100% accurate (I would say 80% accurate), gets stuck often, loud (lots of cranking) and feels flimsy... Tip: If it ever gets stuck and you've removed all coins from the machine, unscrew the shell. I just did and it turns out there was a nickle that was just stuck... For the price, this product does the job. Not well but just enough...When I start to collect more coins, my plan is to upgrade this machine...
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Good counter for the price!  Cleaning the Unit Out.
customer_reviews.text: This works well. The only downside is that if you have a foreign coin in there that won't process, it stays in the machine. I cleaned mine out after use, dust, hair, stray coins, etc. Remove the three screws on the bottom, remove the handle to access. Easy. It will sometimes jam a bit. Just turn the handle counter-clockwise (no more than 1/2 of a full rotation). I had to rock it back and forth this way a bit (fwd/back) to clear a couple of jams. Works well overall.
customer_reviews.author: Debster

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it mostly works
customer_reviews.text: This coin counter is not super accurate - with or without the paper rolls in the tubes, there's a bit of guesswork on when the tubes are actually 'full' and we frequently have rolls that are 1-2 coins short or 1 coin over (dimes). It also mis-sorts dimes and pennies into other tubes so you have to double check before wrapping (easier without the papers in the tubes). Impossible to get out a foreign object (like a paper clip or foreign coin) from the hopper, wish the top flipped open for that. And for unjamming / coins that get on edge. So, could be better but for twenty bucks it does the bulk of the sorting and counting for us.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Coins
customer_reviews.text: I received the unit and immediately started to use it. It was fun until I realize that a lot of dimes were mix with the pennies. I though it was my mistake, by cranking to fast or to slow but I tried over and over again and there were a lot of mixed coins. So now I have to go very slow, watch where each dime and pennies gets dropped and then stop, pull the collector out, get the wrong coin and start over again. Sadly it doesn't work correctly and will have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel R.

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I just got this yesterday and in one 45-minute session I sorted and rolled a little over $100 worth of coins in my change jar. That would have taken me a whole lot longer to go through and separate and roll the coins manually. Yes, the sorter is just plastic and jams quite a bit, but a half turn back and the jam clears. I also love the ease of sliding the wrappers down over the coins while they are in the tubes. It makes it so much easier to wrap them. A great deal for $25. If it lasts a year it will have been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Eggchick

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for home use.
customer_reviews.text: We used it to sort about $500 worth of coins collected through the years. There were a few snags we ran into during the sorting process but they were all pretty easy (but inconvenient) fixes and we were back to sorting in no time. Had we taken it to a Coinstar machine, the exchange rate would have cost us about $60. We were unsure if we're going to keep this as it did have some issues but the price was right so we kept it! Pro: This machine was well worth it at $25, it was definitely a good investment even for a 1-time use. Con: Be prepared to fix snags during sorting process
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Mnaual Coin Sorter
customer_reviews.text: Convenient manual coin sorter by Royal Sovereign. I had quite a bit of change I needed to sort and sleeve. After reading all the reviews, I was a little skeptical on order this as coin sorters, in the past, have not worked out well for me. Gave this one a shot and, so glad I did. This is not a perfect sorter by far but, it certainly did do the job well. The trick is to not overload the chute, Take your time, Do not sleeve until after sorting and, Do be prepared for a couple of miss sorts (particularly with pennies and dimes... not many at all though). Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Broke after sorting ~$60.  Stopped sorting quarters.
customer_reviews.text: I cautiously bought this, due to the mixed reviews. But there enough 5 stars that I thought I'd gamble. Bad call. From the beginning it would sort dimes into the penny slot about 5-10% of the time. Annoying, but I could manually sort them out. But after $60, the quarters stopped getting sorted. I was very careful to follow the clockwise/counterclockwise direction they gave. And to top things off, it would start to 'eat' my money and not release the coins. Took a good amount of vigorous shaking to get my money out. Sending back to manufacturer. Not ready for primetime.
customer_reviews.author: Dre101

customer_reviews.title: Hand sorting worked better for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use the machine to sort and roll my coins. It did a pretty good job with the quarters and dimes, but it had a hard time telling the difference between nickels and pennies. The machine would jam so often that I kept a butter knife in my work area to unstop jams. I had tried to use the hand crank machine and it would not work at all. I thought the electric version with the patented anti-jam option would work better. It did work better but not much. I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews first, like I do for all products. Thought this would be the right one for me. It's compact and built fairly strong. PROS - Coin tubes allow just the right amount of coins to equal the $$ of a roll. Sorts pretty fast. If you buy the coin wrappers in the store that have the one end "rolled" already, they fit right into the tubes. CONS - Occasionally the handle jams. When it does, turn it backwards 180 degrees, jam is cleared! Sometimes throws dimes into the pennies tube. Can't put coin wrappers from the bank into the tubes. Wrappers need to be rounded to allow coins to slide in.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin E Berwald

customer_reviews.title: Wish It Worked
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a pretty good idea but seems like the design needs some tweaking. The first one I received jammed within 20 minutes or so and I could not unjam it. I had little jams along the way and as per the instructions, I gently rotated the arm counterclockwise. That worked, until it didn't. I returned it for a replacement and had the same experience with the replacement, so I had to return that one as well. Also, after the coins drop into their respective cylinders (sometimes in the wrong cylinder), you still have to count them manually because there's no line that indicates when you've reached $10 or $2 etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D

customer_reviews.title: does not work do not waste your money on this product or this company
customer_reviews.text: actually bought two. the first one came with the plastic coin holders broken. contacted the company and they wanted a lot of info from me they to get a response. gave up and bought another one. this one looked like someone's reject that was just taped shut and sent out again. the handle was missing from the box. I thought I could put all the parts together and get one to work. no luck. both are jammed and I can't get the coins out. did not overload as I read this would happen. such a poor product and support for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as other sorters I've tried, but coin tubes don't always fill consistently.
customer_reviews.text: Works w/o too much hassle, but I found it hard to ensure a consistent number of coins dropped into the tubes. The unit lacks an easy way of checking on jammed coins, with the only option being to turn the handle backwards. I would prefer a removable top for access. Having now seen the hand-crank model, I wonder if the electric versions are better or not. Once the coins are sorted, I found it more accurate to use a tray that allows you to place the coins into groups of 5 coins for more accuracy before placing the coins into coin rolls.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work and didn’t come with the needed parts.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coin counter used, in “Like New!” condition. It arrived loose in a big box rattling around. It didn’t have the clear coin sleeves that are completely needed for the device to even work, otherwise the coins just fall into another unsorted pile. The exterior of the coin sorter had two huge stickers which were a mess to try and remove. Of course, I removed them before finding out it didn’t work. I usually get a great deal with used amazon products, but this time it was a waste of time and energy. I had bought it as a present, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Smurfnibble

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: This coin sorter Works awesome. Just keep in mind that you have to turn the manual crank really slow otherwise it will Jam. If it jams all you have to do is back it up a couple turns and go forward a couple turns and maybe repeat, but other than that it works great. I found that it actually works best if you fill the hopper and then slowly turn the crank because if you try to feed the coins in slow they fall through the slot way too fast and causes it to jam.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Bristol

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good; glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good coin sorter. It does occasionally get jammed, but most mini-jams clear very quickly by just reversing the handle. Most difficult jams are cause by odd coins (or other debris) getting stuck - I had a big bag of coins w a few small euro coins and Guatemalan quezal in the bag apparently. The foreign coins caused serious jams that required several minutes to clear. Also a Bobby pin. I also found it works best if you don’t get too ambitious with the number of coins you drop in at once.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Change finally organized
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate carrying change around in my pocket. For years I would throw it into a cup holder in my car. That changed because twice my car was broken into and the change was stolen. So I purchased this and now I bring my change in the house and put it in this coin sorter. Works perfectly! You have to go slow with it as if it gets stuck just crank the opposite way for half a crank and it gets unstuck. Now I save all my change for vacations and have them all rolled when I bring them into the bank
customer_reviews.author: Brian Appell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate and works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a battery operated coin sorter that we've had for 20 years that stopped working. I was hoping to find another one similar as it really did a good job. I couldn't find anything like we had (20 years is a long time), but I found this device that didn't need batteries and it had decent reviews. Other than it being a bigger than I would have liked, it works really well. I followed the advice of other reviewers and I don't overload the top with coins and I turn the handle slowly to prevent jams. I've been using it for a few days and not one jam. For our purpose, it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H.

customer_reviews.title: not perfect but very convenient
customer_reviews.text: An improved design would be if you can easily flip the hood to fix any issues going on, best thing to do is to remove the 3 screws and remove the handle screw as well. That way you can pop the lid off easily. many times the device is not to blame, you could have some debris or 2 coins stuck together causing problems. The crank works fine without the screw. This is definitely worth any user intervention, saves a lot of work rolling up coins manually.
customer_reviews.author: jester

customer_reviews.title: Great value for an efficient machine!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great. I rolled $1,000 of mixed coins in 4 hours. Very simple process. Confirm the proper amount of coins in your first set of rolls and then use those to double check the rest you roll. I used the Royal Sovereign wrappers and they were great. As another reviewer mentioned, sometimes the handle sticks. Just reverse turn the handle a half turn and the jam clears. Highly recommended. A funny note, I was on vacation and happened to see The Price is Right. This coin roller was one of the items in a pricing game and it was valued at $60.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: I will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about it. No batteries to replace. It's actually kind of fun. I've had no problems with it. The last time I used it I unknowingly dumped two 1 dollar coins in it and it would jam a bit but still nothing crazy and after sorting over $300 I found the large coins still tumbling around. So as long as you only put in quarters, penny's, nickels and dimes it works wonderfully. I'm always impressed every time I use it because it's so simple and works so well there's no reason for me to look at the more expensive higher end electric ones.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Works Pretty Good.
customer_reviews.text: It sure beats hand sorting, but it does occasionally jam and the tubes are not accurate per how many coins are in them. I sort with the machine and put the tube on a small kitchen scale and weigh them. An extra step but totally accurate by weight, and then wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cessna

customer_reviews.title: Not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this particular coin sorter suffers from a few fatal flaws. For starters the coins get jammed in the top where you funnel the coins into the machine. After you manage to get the jam out by shaking the daylights out of it, you have a new problem. The dimes end up going into the penny slot so you have to unroll both of them to make sure you have the right coins in the correct wrapper. Last but not least, the crank handle gets stuck on the gears and does not crank too many times. Going back - Not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Counts well and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I read an earlier review that stated just use the collector tube till its full then put the paper roll fully over the coins tip tube upside down remove works great every time accurate count into collector tube full to top once in a while a penny bounced into another tube....probably me to fast but as instructions say it stuck once or twice reverse abot 180 it got going again no problem...I love it
customer_reviews.author: Mike Binns

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, but some might not like it. This is a cheap plastic machine that jams very easily and many dimes end up in the penny section. I got so frustrated with the coins jamming that I removed the top so I could manually move the coins around in the hopper (to prevent jams and release jams). Overall, this is fine if you just want to use it once in a while. Not recommended for business/commercial use.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This works well for people who just have large amounts of change around the house and in the car, who need to sort it every few months. Its hand cranked so you need to be slow and gentle. But if your not sorting coins for a buissness it doesnt matter, its more about convenience. What i didnt like about the machine: 1.the hopper handle is plastic on metal, eventually that plastic will break. Plastic never binds well with metal. 2. The little coin trays arent completely or always accurate. You may need to now count that there is 50 pennies inside the sleeve or weigh it. Overall i think its a great product if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: KingLmoBuyear

customer_reviews.title: Good but delicate
customer_reviews.text: Good product, had been using an electrical/batt operated one for the past few years and had to replace them almost every year. Got the manual one this year, it is a good product, but you need to be careful you do not get overly eager or aggressive when counting your coins. Because if there is a jam, and you continue to crank the handle... it will damage the machine. Outside that, fairly well build in counting coin.
customer_reviews.author: Aman S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for sorting coins, but requires patience
customer_reviews.text: The machine worked beautifully. Sorted tons of coins for penny wars at my son's school. You have to be patient though. The pennies were filling up more quickly than the other coins for us, so we had to stop and roll those more frequently. Occasionally a coin would jam and block a slot. Not too much trouble to clear. You just remove the coins that are to be sorted, take off the coin holders and shake the machine gently. Way better than losing 10% to coinstar or spending hours hand counting.
customer_reviews.author: Missie

customer_reviews.title: RETURNED!
customer_reviews.text: The Pro's and Con's; Pro's...Its was returnable which I promptly did after in jammed for the um-teethed time Cons....Jams easily , coins (penny's) often deposited into other slots, doesn't hold standard bank coin wrappers adding to the time and frustration. got thru about $500 in coins and the device locked up for good and was not fixable. Find another was to count your change, it will cause you less stress than dealing with this plastic contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Control By Hand is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this product to electric or battery-powered models because it doesn't jam up uncontrollably. HOWEVER, it's a really good idea to remove a few simple screws to give access to the workings, so you can monitor what's happening and avoid jams. DO NOT turn the crank backwards to clear jams. Turning backwards allows smaller coins to enter the quarter and nickel slots. Coins vary slightly in thickness, so if you sort large amounts of chang invest in a scale and weigh the coins to get proper counts. I'm sure there are more professional machines that work even better, but not at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Alden E. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Useless: sorts 5 to 6 dimes in each role of pennies.
customer_reviews.text: Also purchased the matching pre-rolled paper coin tubes and inserted the paper tubes into the plastic receptacles as instructed. Slowly cranked the handle with the front door open to observe. Thought I saw silver coins going into the penny receptacle and I was right. You will be selling $.50 rolls of pennies to your bank, except there is a dollar's worth of coins inside the roll. Your bank will love you! I also noticed that the quarter receptacle appeared full but did a check count and that was short 2 quarters. Not worth the effort if I have to count every tube of coins. Both items are on their way back (to different Amazon return centers).
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Works great - just crank slowly!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for household use. Just crank at medium speed (one cycle per second). If resistance occurs, back off the crank half a turn and start again. Repeat the process if necessary. The correct number of coins should fill the tubes level to their tops, but to make sure, I measured the weights (in grams for accuracy) of each correctly filled roll (including the wrapper) using my kitchen scale. Here they are: 50 pennies = 13.1 g..; 40 nickels = 19.4 g.; 50 dimes = 11.3 g.; 40 quarters = 22.6 g. The weight will vary +/- 0.1 g. depending upon how much crud has accumulated or erosion has occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but do not overload the hopper. Worked best one handful of coins at a time. Don't turn the crank too fast, less than 60 rpm. Stop and reverse the minute you feel resistance. Following these steps, the sorter worked great. Had problems with Susan B and Sacajuwea coins. Had trouble getting those out. Just be careful what coins you feed it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney S. Shishido

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: It will jam and i mean 'a lot'. But, it's manual, no electric motor to burn out or jam things up really bad. Just back up a wee bit and start spinning again. We've only had it jam up one time where we had a little problem getting the coins dislodged. All in all, I'd buy it again. It is a time saver and i think it's very accurate. Just fill up the tubes without the coin wrappers and it's right every time. My wife is thrilled with it for some odd reason. She thinks she's 'making' money. I gave her the coin jar, and she's obsessed. She says its the best thing I've bought in the last year.
customer_reviews.author: handyman1234

customer_reviews.title: Wrappers are not included....that’s annoying
customer_reviews.text: A simple but effective product. The description on the site made me think that wrappers were included. They are not, so now I have to buy them. Annoying! Package was damaged, but fortunately the product was not. Also, some of the coins go in the wrong column, so better to manually wrap them for accuracy. I guess it’s better than counting and wrapping.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquellen Cicchetto

customer_reviews.title: If you like challage...
customer_reviews.text: It is ok for the price when using it for a short while. One can even have some fun using it. However, it is a pain in the butt when it gets jammed, and it mixes cents with dimes frequently. Definitely not for commercial use...maybe few hundreds worth of coins once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: PAWEL

customer_reviews.title: Nice Concept
customer_reviews.text: After I bought this, I learned that the bank will not take rolled coins. They will only take them loose for their counter. Thus I have no need for it now. I always had to roll them in the past.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cheshier

customer_reviews.title: Royal Sovereign Manual Coin Sorter Plagued by Jams
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to help my wife do her volunteer job of wrapping coins donated in jars to the local animal shelter. It's somewhat of a help but is plagued with frequent jams. The coins she sorts frequently contain damaged ones or foreign coins. The collections average $200 -$300 per month with a heavy concentration of pennies. When it jams it is necessary to disassemble the sorter and free the jam. Since it is primarily made of plastic, at some point the holes where the screws go to put it together will get stripped. I would have trouble recommending this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: McGregor2

customer_reviews.title: Might be the worst thing I’ve ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Literally got jammed within seconds of use. Only put a handful of coins in to test it and it got jammed. Took me tens of minutes to get it unjammed. Can’t get into the important parts to fix or unjam basically had to use a small flathead screw driver and shake til I got the coins back out. Maybe it was defective maybe not but it was so awful I don’t even want to mess with a replacement. Hopefully you have a better experience than me but if I were you I’d try something else
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Read all the instructions and remember it is plastic
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked great .I did 400 dollars worth of coins , wrapped and counted , in about an hour . I can see someone breaking the machine if they were in a big hurry and forcing the handle . ITS PLASTIC , IT WILL BREAK ! If you fail to red the instructions , one would reverse the handle to try to clear jam . There is a warning on the hopper that says do not turn handle in reverse more than 180 degrees or machine will break ,SO DON'T DO IT ! Great machine , would give it 5 stars if it was all steel and motorized , not gonna get that for 30 bucks!!!!
customer_reviews.author: brian driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Not good for large amounts o coins
customer_reviews.text: We have over $1000.00 in coins. The pennys starting jamming right away. I can understand that. Some are are pretty badly damaged, bent or nicked. So then I started running just nickles, dimes and quarters. It worked okay for about $350.00. Now the quarters wont come out. I tried emptying and reloading just quarters several time and none come out. I've returned the machine and ordered the manual tube type. This will take a lot longer but a lot less aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: JJG

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Easy
customer_reviews.text: This product is great!! My kids and I love tossing coins in there. When it jams, a simple reverse crank clears it up and back at it...really hasn't happened often. My only negative is it's tough to tell exactly when you've reached your limit. Sometimes coins fly off the top and you assume it's full and it's 1 coin short, so I end up counting them all anyway while in the tube. But still way easier than hand sorting them!! For the price, it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Perez

customer_reviews.title: DON'T FEED IT HALF-DOLLARS or the large Eisenhour Dollar coins! They'll disappear inside
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great coin sorter! But there are a few things to look out for. DON'T FEED IT HALF-DOLLARS or the large Eisenhour Dollar coins! They'll disappear inside the machine and never come out! This will kick off strange activity such as pennies going into your Nickle stack, and nickles going into your Quarter stack. Even a deformed penny will jam up the penny exit and divert pennies into the Nickle stack. Just watch the coins as they exit to be safe. For the money, this is better than similarly priced electric, because you can Reverse direction to clear jams.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Just okay not great.
customer_reviews.text: This product was just okay meh. It has a tendency to jam up if you go too fast and it is not always accurate. I ended up separating my coin out into pre-counted piles and just used it to get coins into paper wrappers and it worked well doing it that way aside from the times it jammed up and I had to take it apart a few times to get the jams out.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it to work
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work to save me time from counting coins but it jammed after a few cranks got that fixed but was never sure where the fill line was to have correct amount. I even purchased a scale as another user recommended that did not work. I ended up counting the rolls to make sure correct amount was in them. And like another one said it would put wrong change in wrong slots so you had to really watch it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jams easily
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. It jams easily, and there's no easy way to release the jammed coins. The only way I could figure out how to do it was by dumping all of the coins out of the hopper. It's also difficult to know when a wrapper has the correct number of coins in it. Some had an extra coin, some were short a coin, and some were correct.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Crank It
customer_reviews.text: I love this little machine. I find it oddly therapeutic cranking the handle and seeing the coins get sorted into the various tubes. The sorting is accurate; I've manually verified a handful of rolls across denominations and found no errors. The crank does get stuck from time to time, but you just need to be gentle and reverse slowly so that you won't break the handle. I feel this trade-off beats the digital counters which rely on batteries any day.
customer_reviews.author: J. Law

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Always jams, at first did as said and it came unjammed. the last time it jammed could not get it clear. also drops the wrong money in the wrong slots. dimes fell into the pennies. Also doesnt fill it exactly as the roll should be, So you have to take the money out and count it. So whats the point. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: penny cadenhead

customer_reviews.title: remove thepennies
customer_reviews.text: While it does make sorting and rolling coins easier, I found if I left pennies in the coins I put in the hopper, they would not slide into the tube but would buildup in th machine and eventually jam it. Sorting pennies out before putting in hopper solved this but should not happen in the first place. Another thing was nickels constantly overshoot the tube and must be put in manually. Once I learned this , I was able to sort and roll pretty well. If not for those 2 issues, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT E WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad machine but not entirely accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Over all I DO like this machine, but the first time I used it it jammed and took a bit of work to unjam it. Then I noticed that it isn't as accurate as I'd like. Being a little retentive I would recount each roll and usually I would find it a few coins short. If you don't mind recounting each roll to be safe then go for it i guess. Honestly i got more use out of the coin wraps themselves.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pease

customer_reviews.title: Clogs
customer_reviews.text: This product is very basic for coin rolling. My two problems are that you have to recount the first rolls to know its accurate because its not necessarily easy to tell by look, and also it clogs easily. It has directions on how to back spin to unclog which didn't work well. I just smacked it a few times to get it to go again. Yes I know not the smartest thing. It did occasionally try to put dimes in the nickels and nickels in the pennies, not sure if this is a clog issue or a mis-sort.
customer_reviews.author: Grace McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in a single hour
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, and this change sorter paid for itself within an hour of using it. The only issues I had were a few mis-sorts of various coins, and the screw to secure the handle isn’t quite long enough. The coin tubes bounce around during the sorting process, so I had to hold them against the sorter while cranking the handle. Read several of the reviews prior to purchasing, so I knew about the risk of jamming ahead of time. Thankfully I didn’t have that issue, and the instructions to reverse a jam are labeled on the inside of the hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I had about 2 years worth of change built up. Our bank stopped taking unrolled change last year, and we really weren’t looking forward to rolling coins for days... the machine at Walmart was gonna charge 10%... but then I found this gem on amazon. In about 2 hours, we rolled $702 in quarters, dimes, nickels and pennies! Definitely worth the investment! It did jam up on a half dollar coin... turn the handle slow and steady and there weren’t any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Wells

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I know that you get what you pay for.. but I still expected better. There was a screw provided that was supposed to be screwed in to the gleaned crank, didn’t fit. The crank jams up pretty often if you don’t keep a very specific pacing. The smaller coins constantly sort into the larger slots. So you keep having to stop and fish them out. Also there’s no real precise way to make sure you’re always getting the exact right amount into the roller. I felt like every other one I checked was off by one. I would not recommend this. Just spend the extra money and get an electronic one. I’m going to.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Meyerowitz

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tonight and wrapped over $70 worth of change. Worked great. Like in the other reviews, you do have to back up every once in a while when it gets jammed but no big deal. It would be nice if the cover was clear so you could see what was going on in the mechanism. I poured in some change from a bowl and it also had a safety pin in it that jammed up the machine and I couldn't get it out so I had to take the cover off. That would be my other request is to have a more easily removable cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sorted Well
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, sorted my change pile in no time. I would recommend for easy sorting projects, it's a competitively valued item made for homeowners or light duty retail use in my opinion. Note the warning regarding coins jamming the mechanism and the manufacturer's warning instruction to clear a jam. I experienced jamming quite often but a slight twist back on the operating handle quickly and easily cleared the blockage with virtually no effort. I would recommend for the usage mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: Not the manufacturer

customer_reviews.title: It is a shame....
customer_reviews.text: It is a shame but it does not really fully work. As other reviewers have mentioned, it has trouble differentiating between pennies and dimes. Dimes go into the penny tube very often. We ended up doing the pennies by hand. It does a good job with quarters and nickles. Also as mentioned by others, it gets stuck. Most times easy to deal with by turning the handle backwards, but at times there is no other solution than taking the machine apart. We did not verify that the tubes, when full, have the right amount of coins. It is a shame that it does not work. We would not recommend its purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chimp'o the Neighbor

customer_reviews.title: Fun sorter, but kinda large and delicate-seeming. Sorts very well.
customer_reviews.text: Fun sorter. Functions well, but is kinda huge, and there's no way to get at coins that are 'stuck' inside. I guess it can be turned upside down, but... the inner portion is sealed. We had a Liberty dollar stuck in there 'cause it wasn't a quarter. Kudos to the machine for not sorting it as a quarter, but it was stuck for a while. I had to shake it to get the dollar back out the top. DO NOT CRANK BACKWARDS! The instructions also say so. It will break the machine. It feels... delicate..plastic. BUT, it works, and it's fun. The handle can be unscrewed to save space/etc.
customer_reviews.author: L. Seltzer

customer_reviews.title: Not totally 100% perfect... but for the price, it is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the $1000 in coins that I sorted. But, yeah... it does get quirky at times and I had to do quite a bit of reverse cranking sometimes when I did the dime and penny sorting. But still WAY FASTER than a totally manual sort and wrap. I figured out that things worked quite a bit better if I did not fill the hopper more than 1/3 full... probably less pressure and reduced jamming as a result. But even with the jam-ups, it was quick and straight forward. I definitely recommend! It was not totally 100% perfect... but for the price, it is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Brand

customer_reviews.title: Great for sorting coins, Not compatible with 50c and $1 coins.
customer_reviews.text: Sorts coins quickly and is pretty accurate when it comes to counting the coins, HOWEVER, IT DOES NOT SUPPORT DOLLAR COINS! Once the coins are inside, the only way to get them out is by taking off the top of the unit but that's not very hard. Three screws and removing the handle is all it takes and then you can use it without the cover on, which is fine by me. IF you have to sort DOLLAR OR FIFTY CENT COINS GET SOMETHING ELSE.
customer_reviews.author: mikhsoj

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Wrap those pennies into $$$
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. I ran about $200 in change through it! Took 2 hours or so. The trick: slow and steady wins the race. Take it slow, don’t over fill the hopper, and if it binds up, reverse 1/4 turn and move forward. Fill the tubes all the way to the top. Error on the side of, the last coin should be slightly above rim of the tube. This way you don’t short the stack.
customer_reviews.author: eytjes

customer_reviews.title: So satisfying and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It worked for me! Crank it at a steady pace and it won’t jam on you. If it gets stuck, half crank it opposite way and it should free up. Simple enough. Purchased the same brand rolls and the coins fall into place as they should. My only gripe is the accuracy of the amounts. I have to double check them using a scale. I’m off by one to two coins from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Dvsjp79

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Vending route, roll about 200.00 weekly in change. This machine cuts my time to about 20 minutes versus rolling by hand. Works best if you add a small amount at a time while turning crank. Not perfect, has jammed on me a few times but easy to fix by either turning machine upside down to knock out stuck change or taking it apart (easy) to unclog. Sometimes pennies go in the dime slot but easily removed from the clear tube. I use paper rollers from the bank, just slide over the counter change. Definitely a good purchase overall, big time saver if you have a lot of change to roll!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This coin sorter doesn't work. It constantly jams, and when it isn't jammed, it does a slow, poor job of actually sorting the coins. Save your money and get a set of those 4 colored tubes. It will be cheaper, faster and more accurate. The only saving grace is that Amazon quickly accepted the return of the sorter and refund of my money.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGlide

customer_reviews.title: Turning coins to paper
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was great! As i read in some reviews it can jam if you get to going to fast and add to many coins. Also pay attention to your pennies, i found these are what jammed most often and as long as i was paying attention i would notice the pennies start to slow down and would know to check it. (I just hit it a few times and that usually did the trick to fix the jam). This was a small price to pay to roll over $400 in coins.
customer_reviews.author: Meganl51

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: It is a manual coin sorter that allows you to use rappers if you choose to. For the price that you’re paying it is not bad quality, but it is not great either. If you use this on a stable surface it is decently sturdy and very easy to use. From time to time the coins do get jammed which is a simple fix of Reversing the crank half a turn and then you continue perfectly fine. So far I have wrapped over $100 worth of coins and it has not failed yet which is why I say for the price it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Accurately Sort Change
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this item so that my kids could sort their change but was unfortunately disappointed. The hand crank did not work consistently and change got stuck frequently in the mechanism. The other major issue I had was that the coins did not sort into the proper slots. Dimes were fine because they were the smallest so nothing else could fit through the slot. Quarters, however, were a nightmare - everything fell into the quarters' slot so we quit using it. Needless to say, I have now hand-counted and rolled everything.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMcguire

customer_reviews.title: DOES WHAT IT IS DESIGNED TO DO
customer_reviews.text: Be patient.It's manual not electronic. The instructions are simple and clear. Follow them and you'll be happy. Removing the separated coins from their stacks takes a littler extra patience. But then this is a vlue product not made for commercial use, just occasional use as an individual.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Herford

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Totally inaccurate, cannot separate dimes and pennies accurately, the only coin that works is the quarter( doesn't fit into anything else!) It jams frequently if more than 10 coins put in. I ended up just sorting by hand and using the tubes to store, even then I have to physically count the amount in the tube before wrapping. Overall a waste of money, stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Brit in LA

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews before purchasing this coin counter and when it arrived I read the instructions. With those thoughts in mind I was able to process quite a few coins with minimal jams. However, when there was a jam I was able to clear it without much effort. The coin counter comes in handy especially considering there is soo much change around the house and it makes it very easy to count, rather than counting by hand. And even better than going to an auto coin collector and pay a percent for the machine counting it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ansonia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Makes my change usable money easily
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of change on a daily basis, but it does add up rather quickly. Having a coin sorter means I just drop it in every day and turn the crank. It sorts it the quarters, nickles, dimes, and pennies into the preformed wrappers that fit into the sorter. A few cranks later (sometimes you have to back up to fix a coin jam) you have usable money that my bank will exchange for cash or apply to my account. A very reasonably priced fix for daily pocket change.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Maxey

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have cycled $300.00 to $400.00 worth of change with no issues other the occasional jam, and these are easily cleared. I think most of the problems with this device are operator error. This is a plastic device with many plastic moving parts. It is not commercial grade. Put in a handful of change, take your time, and turn the crank. Don't put the paper sleeves in. Fill them after sorting. At first, fill the tubes and count the coins to verify accuracy. Take your time. It's fun. If you are in that big of a hurry, then go pay the 12% at Coinstar.
customer_reviews.author: runninwild67

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for a battery operated coin wrapper I owned for years - but didn't want to spend $$ for a similar version. I was a little skeptical at first because it was manual but I tried it as soon as I got it home and wrapped most of the chain I had waiting for its arrival. It takes very little effort at all! Just make sure if you feel any resistance, to crank in the opposite direction for a moment to loosen up the coin.
customer_reviews.author: Lori  S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sort consistently at all.  Plastic so it stripped during use.
customer_reviews.text: The qualywas very poor even though the concept is great. Dimes went into the penny roll constantly. Pennies went into the dime and nickel rolls frequently. The platform stopped turning after a good number of rolls even though I was cranking it. It looked like the platform stripped where the spindel goes into it. It was all plastic so not too surprised. I ended up sorting by hand afterall. Suggest you find one with metal gears throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Nazareth

customer_reviews.title: Total crap, don’t waste the money
customer_reviews.text: I spent more time loading and fixing the change as it fell all over the place then I did saving up the change in the first place. You literally have to count the money first so you know how much fills up a roll. There’s nothing to count the change so essentially this machine just dumps coins into the roll and you have to figure out when the amounts right. My biggest issue is the coins don’t fall into the rolls clean, they fall all over and go in sideways half the time. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Constantly jammes
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to give this product any points. It's well thought out, but constantly jambs [right out of the box]. The problem is on the Penney sort where two Penneys jamb in the slot at a time jamming the whole machine. There is no top opening lid to remove the jammed coins so it takes 15min of shaking and rattling to get the jammed coins out. Designers need to make the Penney exit slot a little thinner to stop two Penneys trying to e3xit at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: pmorlimont

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to receive this and start saving time on rolling up coins, but unfortunately the device worked horribly. I read many of the reviews and was very careful the way I handled it and follow the instructions perfectly, however nickels were being put where the quarters go times were being put in the penny rolls, the machine jammed constantly. Spent about 10 minutes using it and it was a complete waste of time and very frustrating. I do not recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for coins , keep foreign objects out
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for me. Please be careful not to have any foreign objects mixed in with your coins. If you do, they will get stuck inside the mechanism and since they don't provide access to the sorting area you will have trouble getting it out. I had a $1 coin mixed in which came out easily but I also had a nail and it was more difficult to shake out. If your coins are clean of objects you should be just fine. Take your time and be patient with turning the wheel and all will go smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to recommend this. If I can I'll give it zero stars. It routinely puts dimes in the penny slot but that is not so bad. I used it to sort $70 worth of coins. It jammed on me three times. It is exceptionally difficult to unjam it. Coins get stuck in the sorter and no amount of shaking will remove them. The last time I had to take the machine apart and even then it took a good 15 minutes to remove the jam. I don't know if the other ones are any better but steer clear of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: It works as intended
customer_reviews.text: If you dont get in a big hurry--as the instructions state, it works great. For the accuracy I suggest counting the exact amount in each tube and mark the top. I dont use the wrappers. Counted two quart jars of mixed change and loved it. As the instructions state, if it jams do not turn the crank backwards more than 180 degrees to clear it.
customer_reviews.author: Pap44

customer_reviews.title: Presort your coins
customer_reviews.text: Unit jams easily. Does not distinguish dimes from pennies well, as well as nickels from quarters. However, for the price, get 4 small bowls and presort your coinage. If you have a kitchen scale, set it for gms and hand count and fill preformed sleeves manually and weigh. Now, feed each denomination into the machine a handful at a time. It took a while but I filled over $570 worth of coins with no bank rejects, when I deposited them.
customer_reviews.author: TOM D

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea With Kinks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for my convenience store and at first I tried it at home and it began to work beautifully. About 15 minutes of use the coins began to jam and sort into the wrong tube. The dimes and pennies were getting stuck inside and it was a bit difficult to get them out. I love the simple use and design, but they need to fix the issues with the wrong sorting and jamming of the smaller coins. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dolphinhart

customer_reviews.title: Didn't quite measure up.
customer_reviews.text: The sorter is just oaky. the coins do not quite goo into the appropriate slots and it is hard to tell if the correct amount of coins are in the coin wrappers. On many occasions, I have to recount the coins in the wrappers, which is a waste of time and effort. I ended up just counting out the coins once I put it to the top of the plastic wrapper sleeves. This was a more accurate count. I think the problem is that the wrapper bottoms are too thick and the manufacturer didn't make the adjustments for the wrappers.
customer_reviews.author: CAMooreofme2

product_meta.title: Royal Sovereign 1 Row ECO-Friendly Manual Hand Crank Coin Sorter (QS-1), Single,Black
product_meta.description:
The QS-1 manual coin sorter is the perfect sorter for business or personal coin sorting. This model is unique in that it requires no electricity or batteries to operate. Simply turn the hand crank and the QS-1 sorts pennies, nickels, dimes, and quarters directly into the 1 row coin tubes below. The large coin hopper holds up to 200 coins at a time. Plastic coin tubes are removable, making it easy to pull out coin-filled wrappers to be rolled and crimped. Hand Crank screws off to save space when storing.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1986, Royal Sovereign has been a global leader in money management equipment including, bill counters, counterfeit detectors, our patented coin sorters, and cash accessories.
feature_bullets: ECO Friendly: No electricity or batteries required for coin sorting.
Large Capacity: Coin sorter can hold up to 200 coins for consumer counting convenience. ; Front door closes for easy storage and keeps dust out
Compact & Portable: Lightweight design for easy mobility.
Fun Coin Sorting: Manual Hand Crank is simple for any consumer to sort at their own pace. Convert your loose change into cash!
Effortless Wrapping: Straight to coin wrapper feature allows the consumer to insert preformed coin wrappers into the coin tubes. Simply pull out coin-filled wrappers and take straight to the bank!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars4,525 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
